newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - ADRs flat in New York trade.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - ADRs flat in New York trade.

text.p: Foreign shares were flat in New York on Friday in quiet trade reflecting the larger market, traders said.
"The shares were basically down last night on the back of a sloppy Wall Street, and they've followed through this morning," a trader said.
"It looks as if they'll close generally lower, with nothing outstanding in individual stocks."
Among European shares, Royal Dutch Petroleum Co rose 1/2 to 166 following a ratings upgrade by Schroder Wertheim to outperform from perform in line.
French television producer Groupe AB fell 1-1/4 to 19-3/4 a day after its American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) began trading in New York. Volume was 506,000 shares.

Shares in Brazilian telecommunications holding Telebras rose 1/2 to 73-3/8 after the Brazilian government said it foresaw the company's partial sale next year and its breakup into regional units. Volume was a heavy 1.5 million shares.
Decliners led advancers by a margin of 298 to 148 among an 807-ADR index. Volume was 22.7 million shares.
